MemberSignature.Usage: new Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool (id, displayName, url, eTag, lastModified, creationTime, state, stateTransitionTime, allocationState, allocationStateTransitionTime, vmSize, cloudServiceConfiguration, virtualMachineConfiguration, resizeTimeout, resizeErrors, currentDedicatedNodes, currentLowPriorityNodes, targetDedicatedNodes, targetLowPriorityNodes, enableAutoScale, autoScaleFormula, autoScaleEvaluationInterval, autoScaleRun, enableInterNodeCommunication, networkConfiguration, startTask, certificateReferences, applicationPackageReferences, applicationLicenses, taskSlotsPerNode, taskSchedulingPolicy, userAccounts, metadata, stats, mountConfiguration, identity, targetNodeCommunicationMode, currentNodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.param: A string that uniquely identifies the Pool within the Account.
The display name for the Pool.
The URL of the Pool.
The ETag of the Pool.
The last modified time of the Pool.
The creation time of the Pool.
The current state of the Pool.
The time at which the Pool entered its current state.
Whether the Pool is resizing.
The time at which the Pool entered its current allocation state.
The size of virtual machines in the Pool. All virtual machines in a Pool are the same size.
The cloud service configuration for the Pool.
The virtual machine configuration for the Pool.
The timeout for allocation of Compute Nodes to the Pool.
A list of errors encountered while performing the last resize on the Pool.
The number of dedicated Compute Nodes currently in the Pool.
The number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes currently in the Pool.
The desired number of dedicated Compute Nodes in the Pool.
The desired number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes in the Pool.
Whether the Pool size should automatically adjust over time.
A formula for the desired number of Compute Nodes in the Pool.
The time interval at which to automatically adjust the Pool size according to the autoscale formula.
The results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Whether the Pool permits direct communication between Compute Nodes.
The network configuration for the Pool.
A Task specified to run on each Compute Node as it joins the Pool.
The list of Certificates to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool.
The list of Packages to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool.
The list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each Compute Node in the Pool.
The number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool.
How Tasks are distributed across Compute Nodes in a Pool.
The list of user Accounts to be created on each Compute Node in the Pool.
A list of name-value pairs associated with the Pool as metadata.
Utilization and resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the Pool.
A list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool.
The identity of the Batch pool, if configured.
The desired node communication mode for the pool.
The current state of the pool communication mode.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CloudPool class.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AllocationState As Nullable(Of AllocationState)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the Pool is resizing.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'steady', 'resizing', 'stopping'

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AllocationStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)
member this.AllocationStateTransitionTime : Nullable<DateTime> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the Pool entered its current allocation state.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationLicenses As IList(Of String)
member this.ApplicationLicenses : System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each Compute Node in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses. If a license is requested which is not supported, Pool creation will fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationPackageReferences As IList(Of ApplicationPackageReference)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of Packages to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: Changes to Package references affect all new Nodes joining the Pool, but do not affect Compute Nodes that are already in the Pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 Package references on any given Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AutoScaleEvaluationInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time interval at which to automatically adjust the Pool size according to the autoscale formula.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if the Pool automatically scales, i.e. enableAutoScale is true.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AutoScaleFormula : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of Compute Nodes in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if the Pool automatically scales, i.e. enableAutoScale is true.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if the Pool automatically scales, i.e. enableAutoScale is true.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property CertificateReferences As IList(Of CertificateReference)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of Certificates to be installed on each Compute Node in the Pool.
Docs.remarks:
For Windows Nodes, the Batch service installs the Certificates to the specified Certificate store and location. For Linux Compute Nodes, the Certificates are stored in a directory inside the Task working directory and an environment variable AZ_BATCH_CERTIFICATES_DIR is supplied to the Task to query for this location. For Certificates with visibility of 'remoteUser', a 'certs' directory is created in the user's home directory (e.g., /home/{user-name}/certs) and Certificates are placed in that directory.
Warning: This property is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cloud service configuration for the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This property and virtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified. This property cannot be specified if the Batch Account was created with its poolAllocationMode property set to 'UserSubscription'.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property CreationTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)
member this.CreationTime : Nullable<DateTime> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the creation time of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property CurrentDedicatedNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.CurrentDedicatedNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of dedicated Compute Nodes currently in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property CurrentLowPriorityNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.CurrentLowPriorityNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes currently in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes which have been preempted are included in this count.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentNodeCommunicationMode As Nullable(Of NodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the pool communication mode.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'default', 'classic', 'simplified'

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DisplayName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the Pool.
Docs.remarks: The display name need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableAutoScale As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableAutoScale : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the Pool size should automatically adjust over time.
Docs.remarks: If false, at least one of targetDedicatedNodes and targetLowPriorityNodes must be specified. If true, the autoScaleFormula property is required and the Pool automatically resizes according to the formula. The default value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableInterNodeCommunication As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableInterNodeCommunication : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the Pool permits direct communication between Compute Nodes.
Docs.remarks: This imposes restrictions on which Compute Nodes can be assigned to the Pool. Specifying this value can reduce the chance of the requested number of Compute Nodes to be allocated in the Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ETag : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ETag of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This is an opaque string. You can use it to detect whether the Pool has changed between requests. In particular, you can be pass the ETag when updating a Pool to specify that your changes should take effect only if nobody else has modified the Pool in the meantime.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Id : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that uniquely identifies the Pool within the Account.
Docs.remarks: The ID can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters. The ID is case-preserving and case-insensitive (that is, you may not have two IDs within an Account that differ only by case).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identity of the Batch pool, if configured.
Docs.remarks: The list of user identities associated with the Batch pool. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property LastModified As Nullable(Of DateTime)
member this.LastModified : Nullable<DateTime> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the last modified time of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This is the last time at which the Pool level data, such as the targetDedicatedNodes or enableAutoscale settings, changed. It does not factor in node-level changes such as a Compute Node changing state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the Pool as metadata.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MountConfiguration As IList(Of MountConfiguration)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: This supports Azure Files, NFS, CIFS/SMB, and Blobfuse.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the network configuration for the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ResizeErrors As IList(Of ResizeError)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of errors encountered while performing the last resize on the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This property is set only if one or more errors occurred during the last Pool resize, and only when the Pool allocationState is Steady.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ResizeTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.ResizeTimeout : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of Compute Nodes to the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This is the timeout for the most recent resize operation. (The initial sizing when the Pool is created counts as a resize.) The default value is 15 minutes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Task specified to run on each Compute Node as it joins the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property State As Nullable(Of PoolState)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: Possible values include: 'active', 'deleting'

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property StateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)
member this.StateTransitionTime : Nullable<DateTime> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the Pool entered its current state.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets utilization and resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This property is populated only if the CloudPool was retrieved with an expand clause including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null. The statistics may not be immediately available. The Batch service performs periodic roll-up of statistics. The typical delay is about 30 minutes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetDedicatedNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TargetDedicatedNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of dedicated Compute Nodes in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetLowPriorityNodes As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TargetLowPriorityNodes : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of Spot/Low-priority Compute Nodes in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TargetNodeCommunicationMode As Nullable(Of NodeCommunicationMode)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired node communication mode for the pool.
Docs.remarks: If omitted, the default value is Default. Possible values include: 'default', 'classic', 'simplified'

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how Tasks are distributed across Compute Nodes in a Pool.
Docs.remarks: If not specified, the default is spread.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TaskSlotsPerNode As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.TaskSlotsPerNode : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of task slots that can be used to run concurrent tasks on a single compute node in the pool.
Docs.remarks: The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the vmSize of the pool or 256.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Url : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UserAccounts As IList(Of UserAccount)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of user Accounts to be created on each Compute Node in the Pool.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the virtual machine configuration for the Pool.
Docs.remarks: This property and cloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.VmSize : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the Pool. All virtual machines in a Pool are the same size.
Docs.remarks: For information about available sizes of virtual machines in Pools, see Choose a VM size for Compute Nodes in an Azure Batch Pool (https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).
